contentrichtext.text: {{Redirect|F.N.G.|the military term|FNG syndrome}} {{Infobox Album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = F.N.G. | Type = compilation | Artist = [[Suicidal Tendencies]] | Cover = FNG.jpg | Released = June 29, 1992 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Crossover thrash]], [[punk metal]] | Length = 77:59 | Label = [[Virgin Records]] | Producer = | Last album = ''[[Lights...Camera...Revolution!|Lights... Camera... Revolution!]]''<br />(1990) | This album = ''F.N.G.''<br />(1992) | Next album = ''[[The Art of Rebellion]]''<br />(1992) }} '''''F.N.G.''''' is a compilation album by [[Hardcore punk|hardcore]]/[[Crossover thrash|crossover]] band [[Suicidal Tendencies]]. ==Reception== {{Album reviews | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1Score = {{Rating|3|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r478723|pure_url=yes}} link] | noprose = yes }}<!--List Automatically Moved by DASHBot--> ==Track listing== {{tracklist | title1 = Suicide's an Alternative / You'll Be Sorry | length1 = 2:43 | title2 = Join the Army | length2 = 3:34 | title3 = Trip at the Brain | length3 = 4:30 | title4 = Suicidal Failure | length4 = 2:53 | title5 = I Shot the Devil | length5 = 1:53 | title6 = Suicidal Maniac | length6 = 2:55 | title7 = Institutionalized | length7 = 3:48 | title8 = I Feel Your Pain and I Survive | length8 = 3:26 | title9 = How Will I Laugh Tomorrow | length9 = 6:42 | title10 = Possessed | length10 = 2:06 | title11 = If I Don't Wake Up | length11 = 4:52 | title12 = Two Wrongs Don't Make a Right (But They Make Me Feel a Whole Lot Better) | length12 = 2:45 | title13 = I Saw Your Mommy | length13 = 4:51 | title14 = Human Guinea Pig | length14 = 2:03 | title15 = Subliminal | length15 = 3:06 | title16 = Surf and Slam | length16 = 2:50 | title17 = Possessed to Skate | length17 = 2:29 | title18 = I Want More | length18 = 2:24 | title19 = The Feeling's Back | length19 = 3:56 | title20 = A Little Each Day | length20 = 4:06 | title21 = Suicyco Mania * | length21 = 5:46 | title22 = Pledge Your Allegiance | length22 = 4:31 }} * Although the recording of "Suicyco Mania" is the same one featured on [[How Will I Laugh Tomorrow When I Can't Even Smile Today]], the mix differs in that all vocals sans the title chant are not present - this original version was the b-side to the [[Trip at the Brain]] single and was added to CD reissues of the album complete with more conventional verse/chorus vocals. {{SuicidalTendencies}} {{DEFAULTSORT:F.N.G. (Album)}} [[Category:Suicidal Tendencies albums]] [[Category:1992 compilation albums]] [[Category:English-language compilation albums]] [[Category:Virgin Records compilation albums]] {{1990s-thrash-metal-album-stub}}
